alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 8:27PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northern and central Washington and eastern Hancock Counties... At 826 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Vanceboro to 16 miles southeast of Grand Falls...and moving east AT 45 MPH. Locations impacted include... Calais, Vanceboro, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Topsfield, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, East Machias, Robbinston, Alexander, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper and Northfield. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Dennysville, and between Calais and Topsfield. State Highway 9 between Wesley and Calais. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington
